item.title: Rachel add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Memory believes before knowing remembers. Believes longer than recollects, longer than knowing even wonders." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Accept who you are; and revel in it." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Rachel add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "There is nothing sweeter in this sad world than the sound of someone you love calling your name." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "Everything that is done in this world is done by hope." -- Martin Luther

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Oh well... I'd just been thinking, if you had died, you'd have been welcome to share my toilet." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "Sometimes I write drunk and revise sober, and sometimes I write sober and revise drunk. But you have to have both elements in creation — the Apollonian and the Dionysian, or spontaneity and restraint, emotion and discipline." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Answer to the Great Question... Of Life, the Universe and Everything... Is... Forty-two,' said Deep Thought, with infinite majesty and calm." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "What I need... is a strong drink and a peer group." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams
